meanings.definition: To lose all courage or hope.
meanings.sent1: After failing the test, he desponded and felt like giving up.
meanings.sent2: She desponded when her dreams seemed out of reach.
meanings.sent3: The puppy desponded when it couldn't catch its tail.
meanings.sent4: His desponded spirit was like a wilting flower in the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of despair desponded over his once bright outlook.

meanings.sent1: The team desponded after losing the championship game.
meanings.sent2: She desponded when her hard work went unnoticed.
meanings.sent3: The cat desponded when it couldn't catch the elusive laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His desponded expression mirrored the gloomy weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The weight of disappointment desponded heavily upon his shoulders.
